intro: Helipterum albicans var. graminifolium, commonly known as the slender helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
